news_header: Donald Trump wins the presidential election with 50.8% of the votes, raising concerns and hopes globally regarding his foreign policy, especially towards Ukraine, Russia, and China.
news_text: Donald Trump of the Republican party has won the presidential election with 72,631,585 votes (50.8%), while Kamala Harris of the Democrat party received 67,905,673 votes (47.5%). His victory has sparked global reactions, particularly regarding his foreign policy stance, which may lead to reduced US involvement in global conflicts. In Ukraine, there are mixed feelings about Trump's potential actions, with some fearing a decrease in US support. Meanwhile, European leaders are concerned about security and trade implications. In Israel, Trump's past support is welcomed, but there are worries about his approach to the ongoing conflict in Gaza. China anticipates a challenging trade relationship under Trump's presidency. Overall, Trump's win raises questions about the future of international relations.
